00029     class pDomain
00030     {
00031     public:
00032         virtual bool Within(const pVec &) const = 0; 
00033         virtual pVec Generate() const = 0; 
00034 
00035         virtual pDomain *copy() const = 0; // Returns a pointer to a heap-allocated copy of the derived class
00036 
00037         virtual ~pDomain() {}
00038     };
00039 
00043     class PDPoint : public pDomain
00044     {
00045     public:
00046         pVec p;
00047 
00048     public:
00049         PDPoint(const pVec &p0)
00050         {
00051             p = p0;
00052         }
00053 
00054         ~PDPoint()
00055         {
00056         }
00057 
00058         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00059         {
00060             return false;
00061         }
00062 
00063         pVec Generate() const 
00064         {
00065             return p;
00066         }
00067 
00068         pDomain *copy() const
00069         {
00070             PDPoint *P = new PDPoint(*this);
00071             return P;
00072         }
00073     };

00080     class PDLine : public pDomain
00081     {
00082     public:
00083         pVec p0, p1;
00084 
00085     public:
00086         PDLine(const pVec &e0, const pVec &e1)
00087         {
00088             p0 = e0;
00089             p1 = e1 - e0;
00090         }
00091 
00092         ~PDLine()
00093         {
00094         }
00095 
00096         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00097         {
00098             return false;
00099         }
00100 
00101         pVec Generate() const 
00102         {
00103             return p0 + p1 * pRandf();
00104         }
00105 
00106         pDomain *copy() const
00107         {
00108             PDLine *P = new PDLine(*this);
00109             return P;
00110         }
00111     };

00118     class PDTriangle : public pDomain
00119     {
00120     public:
00121         pVec p, u, v, uNrm, vNrm, nrm;
00122         float uLen, vLen, D;
00123 
00124     public:
00125         PDTriangle(const pVec &p0, const pVec &p1, const pVec &p2)
00126         {
00127             p = p0;
00128             u = p1 - p0;
00129             v = p2 - p0;
00130 
00131             // The rest of this is needed for Avoid and Bounce.
00132             uLen = u.length();
00133             uNrm = u / uLen;
00134             vLen = v.length();
00135             vNrm = v / vLen;
00136 
00137             nrm = Cross(uNrm, vNrm); // This is the non-unit normal.
00138             nrm.normalize(); // Must normalize it.
00139 
00140             D = -dot(p, nrm);
00141         }
00142 
00143         ~PDTriangle()
00144         {
00145         }
00146 
00147         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00148         {
00149             return false;
00150         }
00151 
00152         pVec Generate() const 
00153         {
00154             float r1 = pRandf();
00155             float r2 = pRandf();
00156             pVec pos;
00157             if(r1 + r2 < 1.0f)
00158                 pos = p + u * r1 + v * r2;
00159             else
00160                 pos = p + u * (1.0f-r1) + v * (1.0f-r2);
00161 
00162             return pos;
00163         }
00164 
00165         pDomain *copy() const
00166         {
00167             PDTriangle *P = new PDTriangle(*this);
00168             return P;
00169         }
00170     };
00171 
00177     class PDRectangle : public pDomain
00178     {
00179     public:
00180         pVec p, u, v, uNrm, vNrm, nrm;
00181         float uLen, vLen, D;
00182 
00183     public:
00184         PDRectangle(const pVec &p0, const pVec &u0, const pVec &v0)
00185         {
00186             p = p0;
00187             u = u0;
00188             v = v0;
00189 
00190             // The rest of this is needed for Avoid and Bounce.
00191             uLen = u.length();
00192             uNrm = u / uLen;
00193             vLen = v.length();
00194             vNrm = v / vLen;
00195 
00196             nrm = Cross(uNrm, vNrm); // This is the non-unit normal.
00197             nrm.normalize(); // Must normalize it.
00198 
00199             D = -dot(p, nrm);
00200         }
00201 
00202         ~PDRectangle()
00203         {
00204             // std::cerr << "del " << typeid(*this).name() << this << std::endl;
00205         }
00206 
00207         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00208         {
00209             return false;
00210         }
00211 
00212         pVec Generate() const 
00213         {
00214             pVec pos = p + u * pRandf() + v * pRandf();
00215             return pos;
00216         }
00217 
00218         pDomain *copy() const
00219         {
00220             PDRectangle *P = new PDRectangle(*this);
00221             return P;
00222         }
00223     };

00230     class PDPlane : public pDomain
00231     {
00232     public:
00233         pVec p, nrm;
00234         float D;
00235 
00236     public:
00237         PDPlane(const pVec &p0, const pVec &Normal)
00238         {
00239             p = p0;
00240             nrm = Normal;
00241             nrm.normalize(); // Must normalize it.
00242             D = -dot(p, nrm);
00243         }
00244 
00245         ~PDPlane()
00246         {
00247         }
00248 
00249         // Distance from plane = n * p + d
00250         // Inside is the positive half-space.
00251         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00252         {
00253             return dot(nrm, pos) >= -D;
00254         }
00255 
00256         // How do I sensibly make a point on an infinite plane?
00257         pVec Generate() const 
00258         {
00259             return p;
00260         }
00261 
00262         pDomain *copy() const
00263         {
00264             PDPlane *P = new PDPlane(*this);
00265             return P;
00266         }
00267     };

00276     class PDBox : public pDomain
00277     {
00278     public:
00279         // p0 is the min corner. p1 is the max corner.
00280         pVec p0, p1, dif;
00281 
00282     public:
00283         PDBox(const pVec &e0, const pVec &e1)
00284         {
00285             p0 = e0;
00286             p1 = e1;
00287             if(e1.x() < e0.x()) { p0.x() = e1.x(); p1.x() = e1.x(); }
00288             if(e1.y() < e0.y()) { p0.y() = e1.y(); p1.y() = e1.y(); }
00289             if(e1.z() < e0.z()) { p0.z() = e1.z(); p1.z() = e1.z(); }
00290 
00291             dif = p1 - p0;
00292         }
00293 
00294         ~PDBox()
00295         {
00296         }
00297 
00298         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00299         {
00300             return !((pos.x() < p0.x()) || (pos.x() > p1.x()) ||
00301                 (pos.y() < p0.y()) || (pos.y() > p1.y()) ||
00302                 (pos.z() < p0.z()) || (pos.z() > p1.z()));
00303         }
00304 
00305         pVec Generate() const 
00306         {
00307             // Scale and translate [0,1] random to fit box
00308             return p0 + CompMult(pRandVec(), dif);
00309         }
00310 
00311         pDomain *copy() const
00312         {
00313             PDBox *P = new PDBox(*this);
00314             return P;
00315         }
00316     };
00317 
00323     class PDCylinder : public pDomain
00324     {
00325     public:
00326         pVec apex, axis, u, v; // Apex is one end. Axis is vector from one end to the other.
00327         float len, radOut, radIn, radOutSqr, radInSqr, radDif, axisLenInvSqr;
00328         bool ThinShell;
00329 
00330     public:
00331         PDCylinder(const pVec &e0, const pVec &e1, const float OuterRadius, const float InnerRadius = 0.0f)
00332         {
00333             apex = e0;
00334             axis = e1 - e0;
00335 
00336             if(OuterRadius < InnerRadius) {
00337                 radOut = InnerRadius; radIn = OuterRadius;
00338             } else {
00339                 radOut = OuterRadius; radIn = InnerRadius;
00340             }
00341             radOutSqr = fsqr(radOut);
00342             radInSqr = fsqr(radIn);
00343 
00344             ThinShell = (radIn == radOut);
00345             radDif = radOut - radIn;
00346 
00347             // Given an arbitrary nonzero vector n, make two orthonormal
00348             // vectors u and v forming a frame [u,v,n.normalize()].
00349             pVec n = axis;
00350             float axisLenSqr = axis.length2();
00351             axisLenInvSqr = axisLenSqr ? (1.0f / axisLenSqr) : 0.0f;
00352             n *= sqrtf(axisLenInvSqr);
00353 
00354             // Find a vector orthogonal to n.
00355             pVec basis(1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
00356             if (fabsf(dot(basis, n)) > 0.999f)
00357                 basis = pVec(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
00358 
00359             // Project away N component, normalize and cross to get
00360             // second orthonormal vector.
00361             u = basis - n * dot(basis, n);
00362             u.normalize();
00363             v = Cross(n, u);
00364         }
00365 
00366         ~PDCylinder()
00367         {
00368         }
00369 
00370         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00371         {
00372             // This is painful and slow. Might be better to do quick accept/reject tests.
00373             // Axis is vector from base to tip of the cylinder.
00374             // x is vector from base to pos.
00375             //         x . axis
00376             // dist = ---------- = projected distance of x along the axis
00377             //        axis. axis   ranging from 0 (base) to 1 (tip)
00378             //
00379             // rad = x - dist * axis = projected vector of x along the base
00380 
00381             pVec x = pos - apex;
00382 
00383             // Check axial distance
00384             float dist = dot(axis, x) * axisLenInvSqr;
00385             if(dist < 0.0f || dist > 1.0f)
00386                 return false;
00387 
00388             // Check radial distance
00389             pVec xrad = x - axis * dist; // Radial component of x
00390             float rSqr = xrad.length2();
00391 
00392             return (rSqr <= radInSqr && rSqr >= radOutSqr);
00393         }
00394 
00395         pVec Generate() const 
00396         {
00397             float dist = pRandf(); // Distance between base and tip
00398             float theta = pRandf() * 2.0f * float(M_PI); // Angle around axis
00399             // Distance from axis
00400             float r = radIn + pRandf() * radDif;
00401 
00402             // Another way to do this is to choose a random point in a square and keep it if it's in the circle.
00403             float x = r * cosf(theta);
00404             float y = r * sinf(theta);
00405 
00406             pVec pos = apex + axis * dist + u * x + v * y;
00407             return pos;
00408         }
00409 
00410         pDomain *copy() const
00411         {
00412             PDCylinder *P = new PDCylinder(*this);
00413             return P;
00414         }
00415     };
00416 
00422     class PDCone : public pDomain
00423     {
00424     public:
00425         pVec apex, axis, u, v; // Apex is one end. Axis is vector from one end to the other.
00426         float len, radOut, radIn, radOutSqr, radInSqr, radDif, axisLenInvSqr;
00427         bool ThinShell;
00428 
00429     public:
00430         PDCone(const pVec &e0, const pVec &e1, const float OuterRadius, const float InnerRadius = 0.0f)
00431         {
00432             apex = e0;
00433             axis = e1 - e0;
00434 
00435             if(OuterRadius < InnerRadius) {
00436                 radOut = InnerRadius; radIn = OuterRadius;
00437             } else {
00438                 radOut = OuterRadius; radIn = InnerRadius;
00439             }
00440             radOutSqr = fsqr(radOut);
00441             radInSqr = fsqr(radIn);
00442 
00443             ThinShell = (radIn == radOut);
00444             radDif = radOut - radIn;
00445 
00446             // Given an arbitrary nonzero vector n, make two orthonormal
00447             // vectors u and v forming a frame [u,v,n.normalize()].
00448             pVec n = axis;
00449             float axisLenSqr = axis.length2();
00450             axisLenInvSqr = axisLenSqr ? 1.0f / axisLenSqr : 0.0f;
00451             n *= sqrtf(axisLenInvSqr);
00452 
00453             // Find a vector orthogonal to n.
00454             pVec basis(1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
00455             if (fabsf(dot(basis, n)) > 0.999f)
00456                 basis = pVec(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
00457 
00458             // Project away N component, normalize and cross to get
00459             // second orthonormal vector.
00460             u = basis - n * dot(basis, n);
00461             u.normalize();
00462             v = Cross(n, u);
00463         }
00464 
00465         ~PDCone()
00466         {
00467         }
00468 
00469         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00470         {
00471             // This is painful and slow. Might be better to do quick
00472             // accept/reject tests.
00473             // Let axis = vector from base to tip of the cylinder
00474             // x = vector from base to test point
00475             //         x . axis
00476             // dist = ---------- = projected distance of x along the axis
00477             //        axis. axis   ranging from 0 (base) to 1 (tip)
00478             //
00479             // rad = x - dist * axis = projected vector of x along the base
00480 
00481             pVec x = pos - apex;
00482 
00483             // Check axial distance
00484             // axisLenInvSqr stores 1 / dot(axis, axis)
00485             float dist = dot(axis, x) * axisLenInvSqr;
00486             if(dist < 0.0f || dist > 1.0f)
00487                 return false;
00488 
00489             // Check radial distance; scale radius along axis for cones
00490             pVec xrad = x - axis * dist; // Radial component of x
00491             float rSqr = xrad.length2();
00492 
00493             return (rSqr <= fsqr(dist * radIn) && rSqr >= fsqr(dist * radOut));
00494         }
00495 
00496         pVec Generate() const 
00497         {
00498             float dist = pRandf(); // Distance between base and tip
00499             float theta = pRandf() * 2.0f * float(M_PI); // Angle around axis
00500             // Distance from axis
00501             float r = radIn + pRandf() * radDif;
00502 
00503             // Another way to do this is to choose a random point in a square and keep it if it's in the circle.
00504             float x = r * cosf(theta);
00505             float y = r * sinf(theta);
00506 
00507             // Scale radius along axis for cones
00508             x *= dist;
00509             y *= dist;
00510 
00511             pVec pos = apex + axis * dist + u * x + v * y;
00512             return pos;
00513         }
00514 
00515         pDomain *copy() const
00516         {
00517             PDCone *P = new PDCone(*this);
00518             return P;
00519         }
00520     };
00521 
00527     class PDSphere : public pDomain
00528     {
00529     public:
00530         pVec ctr;
00531         float radOut, radIn, radOutSqr, radInSqr, radDif;
00532         bool ThinShell;
00533 
00534     public:
00535         PDSphere(const pVec &Center, const float OuterRadius, const float InnerRadius = 0.0f)
00536         {
00537             ctr = Center;
00538             if(OuterRadius < InnerRadius) {
00539                 radOut = InnerRadius; radIn = OuterRadius;
00540             } else {
00541                 radOut = OuterRadius; radIn = InnerRadius;
00542             }
00543             if(radIn < 0.0f) radIn = 0.0f;
00544 
00545             radOutSqr = fsqr(radOut);
00546             radInSqr = fsqr(radIn);
00547 
00548             ThinShell = (radIn == radOut);
00549             radDif = radOut - radIn;
00550         }
00551 
00552         ~PDSphere()
00553         {
00554         }
00555 
00556         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00557         {
00558             pVec rvec(pos - ctr);
00559             float rSqr = rvec.length2();
00560             return rSqr <= radOutSqr && rSqr >= radInSqr;
00561         }
00562 
00563         pVec Generate() const 
00564         {
00565             pVec pos;
00566 
00567             do {
00568                 pos = pRandVec() - vHalf; // Point on [-0.5,0.5] box
00569             } while (pos.length2() > fsqr(0.5)); // Make sure it's also on r=0.5 sphere.
00570             pos.normalize(); // Now it's on r=1 spherical shell
00571 
00572             // Scale unit sphere pos by [0..r] and translate
00573             if(ThinShell)
00574                 pos = ctr + pos * radOut;
00575             else
00576                 pos = ctr + pos * (radIn + pRandf() * radDif);
00577 
00578             return pos;
00579         }
00580 
00581         pDomain *copy() const
00582         {
00583             PDSphere *P = new PDSphere(*this);
00584             return P;
00585         }
00586     };
00587 
00593     class PDBlob : public pDomain
00594     {
00595     public:
00596         pVec ctr;
00597         float stdev, Scale1, Scale2;
00598 
00599     public:
00600         PDBlob(const pVec &Center, const float StandardDev)
00601         {
00602             ctr = Center;
00603             stdev = StandardDev;
00604             float oneOverSigma = 1.0f/(stdev+0.000000000001f);
00605             Scale1 = -0.5f*fsqr(oneOverSigma);
00606             Scale2 = P_ONEOVERSQRT2PI * oneOverSigma;
00607         }
00608 
00609         ~PDBlob()
00610         {
00611         }
00612 
00613         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00614         {
00615             pVec x = pos - ctr;
00616             // return exp(-0.5 * xSq * Sqr(oneOverSigma)) * P_ONEOVERSQRT2PI * oneOverSigma;
00617             float Gx = expf(x.length2() * Scale1) * Scale2;
00618             return (pRandf() < Gx);
00619         }
00620 
00621         pVec Generate() const 
00622         {
00623             return ctr + pNRandVec(stdev);
00624         }
00625 
00626         pDomain *copy() const
00627         {
00628             PDBlob *P = new PDBlob(*this);
00629             return P;
00630         }
00631     };
00632 
00638     class PDDisc : public pDomain
00639     {
00640     public:
00641         pVec p, nrm, u, v;
00642         float radIn, radOut, radInSqr, radOutSqr, dif, D;
00643 
00644     public:
00645         PDDisc(const pVec &Center, const pVec Normal, const float OuterRadius, const float InnerRadius = 0.0f)
00646         {
00647             p = Center;
00648             nrm = Normal;
00649             nrm.normalize();
00650 
00651             if(OuterRadius > InnerRadius) {
00652                 radOut = OuterRadius; radIn = InnerRadius;
00653             } else {
00654                 radOut = InnerRadius; radIn = OuterRadius;
00655             }
00656             dif = radOut - radIn;
00657             radInSqr = fsqr(radIn);
00658             radOutSqr = fsqr(radOut);
00659 
00660             // Find a vector orthogonal to n.
00661             pVec basis(1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
00662             if (fabsf(dot(basis, nrm)) > 0.999f)
00663                 basis = pVec(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
00664 
00665             // Project away N component, normalize and cross to get
00666             // second orthonormal vector.
00667             u = basis - nrm * dot(basis, nrm);
00668             u.normalize();
00669             v = Cross(nrm, u);
00670             D = -dot(p, nrm);
00671         }
00672 
00673         ~PDDisc()
00674         {
00675         }
00676 
00677         bool Within(const pVec &pos) const 
00678         {
00679             return false;
00680         }
00681 
00682         pVec Generate() const 
00683         {
00684             // Might be faster to generate a point in a square and reject if outside the circle
00685             float theta = pRandf() * 2.0f * float(M_PI); // Angle around normal
00686             // Distance from center
00687             float r = radIn + pRandf() * dif;
00688 
00689             float x = r * cosf(theta); // Weighting of each frame vector
00690             float y = r * sinf(theta);
00691 
00692             pVec pos = p + u * x + v * y;
00693             return pos;
00694         }
00695 
00696         pDomain *copy() const
00697         {
00698             PDDisc *P = new PDDisc(*this);
00699             return P;
00700         }
00701     };
00702 
00703 };
